results.title: Potential Role of Lisinopril in Reducing Atherosclerotic Risk: Evidence of an Antioxidant Effect in Human Cardiomyocytes Cell Line
results.text_hl: Potential Role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ in Reducing @<m>DISEASE_Atherosclerosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@Atherosclerotic@@@ Risk: Evidence of an Antioxidant Effect in @SPECIES_9606 @@@Human@@@ Cardiomyocytes Cell Line

citations.NLM: Scisciola L, Fontanella RA, Surina, Garofalo G, Rizzo MR, Paolisso G, Barbieri M. Potential Role of Lisinopril in Reducing Atherosclerotic Risk: Evidence of an Antioxidant Effect in Human Cardiomyocytes Cell Line Front Pharmacol. 2022;13():868365. PMID: 35656292

results.title: Evaluation of Adverse Effects of Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin on Hematological and Biochemical Analytes in Wistar Rats
results.text_hl: Combination therapy of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ may be an important concept in developing more effective strategies to treat and prevent @<m>DISEASE_Atherosclerosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@, @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@, and co-morbid @DISEASE_Metabolic_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008659 @@@metabolic disorders@@@.

citations.NLM: Dodiya H, Kale V, Goswami S, Sundar R, Jain M. Evaluation of Adverse Effects of Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin on Hematological and Biochemical Analytes in Wistar Rats Toxicol Int. 2013 May;20(2):170-6. PMID: 24082511
citations.BibTeX: @article{24082511, title={Evaluation of Adverse Effects of Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin on Hematological and Biochemical Analytes in Wistar Rats}, author={Dodiya H and Kale V and Goswami S and Sundar R and Jain M}, journal={Toxicol Int}, volume={20}, number={2}, pages={170-6}}

results.title: Cost-effectiveness of a fixed-dose combination pill for secondary prevention of cardiovascular disease in China, India, Mexico, Nigeria, and South Africa: a modelling study.
results.text_hl: METHODS: We developed microsimulation models to assess the cost-effectiveness of a polypill containing @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Atenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Simvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ for secondary prevention of @<m>DISEASE_Atherosclerosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease@@@ compared with current care in China, India, Mexico, Nigeria, and South Africa.

citations.NLM: Lin JK, Moran AE, Bibbins-Domingo K, Falase B, Pedroza Tobias A, Mandke CN, Kazi DS. Cost-effectiveness of a fixed-dose combination pill for secondary prevention of cardiovascular disease in China, India, Mexico, Nigeria, and South Africa: a modelling study. Lancet Glob Health. 2019 Oct;7(10):e1346-e1358. PMID: 31477544
